summary: I was thinking the other day about how Ewan McGregor would always make the lightsaber sounds when filming and it got me...
body: I was thinking the other day about how Ewan McGregor would always make the lightsaber sounds when filming and it got me thinking…what if the explanation for why we hear sounds in the film’s is because the ship makes them? Like we’re all people and we like our noises and if we can’t hear the pew pee of lasers or the boom of explosions because space, then damn it. We’ll program the ship’s computer to play those sounds when they happen because sound effects man.

summary:
Tecrübeniz sırasında, Tanrı'nın varlığına dair bilgi edindiniz mi? Evet
Evet Güçlü sevgi enerjisinin var olduğuna ve...
body:
Tecrübeniz sırasında, Tanrı'nın varlığına dair bilgi edindiniz mi? Evet Evet Güçlü sevgi enerjisinin var olduğuna ve hepimizin içinde olduğuna veya daha doğrusu kaynaktan gelen enerjiyle dolduğumuza inanıyorum. O saf bir sevgidir. Bitkiler ve hayvanlar pozitif enerjiyi hissedebiliyor ve ben de onu hissedebiliyorum. Gezegenin hayatta kalmasını sağlayan şey budur. Korkarım ki insanlar bunu anlamıyor ve insan tanrıları takip ediyorlar. Bir insan tanrısı ile gerçek Tanrı arasındaki farkı söyleyebilirim çünkü oradaydım. Geçmişi, insanın başlangıcından günümüze kadar gördüm. Hayat çok basit. Aşk ve nefret var. Tanrı'yı ​​tanımanın yolu sevgidir.. 

   Kendileri ve başkaları tarafından hissedilen negatif enerjinin bir sebep ve sonuç olduğunu anlamıyorlar. Tanrı dünyayı harekete geçirdi ama biz kendimizi kontrol ediyoruz. O her zaman aşk için oradadır ama öğrenmek için buradayız. Kendimizi onun gibi derinden sevdiğimizde, O'nun içimizde yaşadığını anlayacağız. Bu dünya güzel bir yer. Dünyayı bize Tanrı'dan bir armağan olarak seviyorum. Umarım nefret enerjisiyle onu ve birbirimizi yok etmeyiz.

title: When The Party's Over
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2WCE94d

by luna (M00NFIRE)

Rey hates parties, but she hates guys who won’t take ‘no’ for an answer even more. So, she does what most girls do, she gives the drunk frat bros a fake number and walks away before they realizes. Which works out pretty well a few times, until it doesn’t.

-
Rey and Kaydel are like 23
Ben is like 28
i dont think i’ll put their ages in there so im putting it here just in case

summary: Do you ever think about an au where  Anakin Rey and Poe race each other and show off sick flips and turns in the falcon?
question: Do you ever think about an au where  Anakin Rey and Poe race each other and show off sick flips and turns in the falcon?
answer:
YES

Poe and Rey are showing off to each other in the falcon and having a blast, Finn feels like he’s on a rollercoaster zooming around and that’s when anakin’s Force Ghost shows up.

“hey kids watch this”

And he takes them all into such a tight spin they crash. Another happy landing

summary: Was watching star wars recently, Anakin Skywalker just makes me so so sad...He was tempted by the dark at such a young age, when...
caption: Was watching star wars recently, Anakin Skywalker just makes me so so sad…He was tempted by the dark at such a young age, when he was so confused and no one in his life seems to be able to offer any answer or the slightest comfort. He has never been truly free for his entire life, first a slave, then a Jedi, then the Sith…And it actually made me wonder if war or even revolution can ever be justified. Sure, you can fight for your own ideology, your belief but what makes you think that you can risk other’s life for it…I find this thought very depressive and thus the drawing as distraction

reblog.comment: Was watching star wars recently, Anakin Skywalker just makes me so so sad…He was tempted by the dark at such a young age, when he was so confused and no one in his life seems to be able to offer any answer or the slightest comfort. Sure, you can fight for your own ideology, your belief but what makes you think that you can risk other’s life for it…I find this thought very depressive and thus the drawing as distraction

title: Heat and Chemistry
description:
by DarkSideOfMe

Kaydel has a secret: in a world that hates alphas, she loves them.
And it shows: in her research, in her books… in her choice of online entertainment.
But who will stand will her when the reason why is revealed?

blog.name: cosplaystarwars
blog.title: Cosplay Star Wars
blog.description: Our Empire Need You! Join Us!

summary: Lekku on swtor Twi’leks look soft. I want to pet them and rub them. Made a Twi’lek, a character brought over from Galaxies....
body:
Lekku on swtor Twi’leks look soft. I want to pet them and rub them.

Made a Twi’lek, a character brought over from Galaxies. Shame on the lack of lekku coverings for guys, I do love the Ys’rak on Galaxies, but these lekku look so soft and squishable I want to bury my face in them.

reblog.comment:
Lekku on swtor Twi’leks look soft. I want to pet them and rub them.

Made a Twi’lek, a character brought over from Galaxies. Shame on the lack of lekku coverings for guys, I do love the Ys’rak on Galaxies, but these lekku look so soft and squishable I want to bury my face in them.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

blog.name: douxreviews
blog.title: Doux Reviews
blog.description: Doux Reviews has been on the web since 2004 and features thousands of episode reviews of the best classic and current television shows, as well as many book and movie reviews. Please visit us!

summary: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999) Review
title: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999) Review
body:
[This review includes spoilers.]

Obi-Wan: “I have a bad feeling about this.”

Probably most sci-fi geeks do just what Dan and I do every time we watch this movie: debate what went wrong.

Let’s see. We have a boy with a great talent, leading a dull and pointless existence on a backwater planet. A great mentor and wise man comes along and sets him on his path before sacrificing his own life. The major focus is saving the life of a beautiful princess. I know what George Lucas had in mind. He was deliberately echoing his first Star Wars movie, now known as Episode Four.

Where I think he really went wrong was the casting. Little Jake Lloyd most certainly did his best with the material, but the character was just too young to carry the weight of the story. Anakin should have been at least fourteen. (The age difference between Anakin and Amidala was too great and made me cringe, thinking about their future relationship.) And the story itself was just too juvenile. Did Lucas not realize that his fans had grown up?

The other major, and I do mean major, mistakes were (1) Jar Jar Binks, (2) the Gungan/droid battle, (3) the incomprehensible political situation, and (4) the endless, oddly boring pod race that we knew Anakin would win. What was the point?

I don’t think anything could have fixed Jar Jar. My instant dislike for him made the Gungans uninteresting as characters, too, which made the huge Gungan/droid battle scene pointless, especially since it was all CGI characters and I had no emotional investment in any of them. It was like watching chess pieces blowing up. Pointless. But the pod race could have been exciting if it had been truly deadly. What if the life of Anakin’s mother had been at stake? What if winning would have meant her death? What if Anakin had had an alien friend also in the race, and he had crashed and died?

So what did I like about The Phantom Menace? Let me think.

It’s visually stunning. This movie was the first in which George Lucas could fully express his imagination on screen without the limitations of puppets and models. The alien landscapes are just amazing, all of them. And then there are my glorious Jedi knights – Ewan McGregor and Liam Neeson, who were both terrific. They gave us one of the best sword fights I’ve ever seen on film, too.

The casting gods smiled on George Lucas when he cast Ewan McGregor as the younger version of the character played so memorably by Sir Alec Guinness. I shudder to think of what the prequel trilogy would have been like without him. And I have always liked Natalie Portman, and I think she did her best as Padme/Amidala. If her performance is mildly wooden, I can readily blame it on the stilted dialogue. Why, oh why didn’t Lucas hire a script doctor? Imagine what this movie would have been like if, say, Joss Whedon had pumped up the dialogue.

Bits and pieces:

– Along with debating What Went Wrong, it can also be fun playing “Who’s behind the make-up” game. Is the Queen Natalie Portman or is it Keira Knightley?

– Mitichlorians. Virgin birth. No and no. And how could they say Anakin is too old to be trained as a Jedi? When do they usually start? When they’re two?

– How could a fourteen-year-old girl be “elected” queen? Idiotic.

– The Sith Lord Darth Maul might have been scarier without horns. And why didn’t they do an establishing scene, with him making mincemeat of some other poor Jedi knight?

– The most famous quote from this movie is Yoda’s. It is constantly parodied. “Fear leads to anger. Anger leads to hate. Hate leads to suffering.”

– Speaking of Yoda, he looks terrible and un-Yoda-like in this movie. Fortunately, he got an upgrade in Episode Two.

I sort of liked this movie when I first saw it. But now, every time I see it, I like it less. One out of four stars.

Billie Doux loves good television and spends way too much time writing about it.
